sub_topic: Calculating the volume of a rectangular pyramid.
message_1: A rectangular pyramid has a rectangular base with a length of 5 cm and a width of 3 cm. The height of the pyramid is 8 cm. Find the volume of the pyramid.
message_2:
To find the volume of a rectangular pyramid, we can use the formula:

Volume = (1/3) × Base Area × Height

The base area of the rectangular pyramid is the area of the rectangle, which can be found using the formula:

Base Area = Length × Width

In this case, the length is 5 cm and the width is 3 cm, so the base area is:

Base Area = 5 cm × 3 cm = 15 cm²

Now we can find the volume of the pyramid using the formula:

Volume = (1/3) × Base Area × Height

Volume = (1/3) × 15 cm² × 8 cm

Volume = (1/3) × 120 cm³

Volume = 40 cm³

So, the volume of the rectangular pyramid is 40 cubic centimeters.
